intro: Campanula linifolia var. ciliata, commonly known as the silky bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation in temperate climates.
